page.title: 01Beachamwell Norfolk
page.content: A conservation village of 250 people encompassing a grean surrounded by its church, pub, village hall, school and post office shop, together with Georgian cottages which orignally housed estate workers. They and later council houses are now largely privately owned. A further 22 houses were added in the 1970s. Employment is provided by the Hall (Training racehorses)three farms and a small garage (restoring MG cars from as far afield as Norway. Other employment has to be found away from Beachamwell. Children over 8 go to Swaffham to school.Transport by coach is available to Swaffham, Kings Lynn and Norwich on market days. A mobile library visits monthly. Milk, newspapers and coal are delivered regularly. The village hall is a thriving centre A neighbouring rector serves four parishes.
